page.title: 11White Cross Farm
page.content: The farmhouse at White Cross is typical of the area. It is built from red brick and has ten rooms. Outside there are 29 outhouses and barns. The farm is divided into fifteen fields. Crops grown include grass, wheat and barley. The farm used to concentrate on dairy cattle but the dairy apparatus has recently been dismantled. Cattle are now reared for beef. The main breeds on the farm are Limousin, Charolais and a cross between Hereford and Friesian. There are also eighty-five Suffolk ewes and two sheepdogs.
